summary.title: Research Impact Overview
content: India contributed 36 research papers to NeurIPS 2024, representing 0.6% of the conference's total accepted works and ranking 17 globally among contributing nations.

India researchers demonstrated strong research leadership with 63.9% of papers featuring India first authors, indicating significant intellectual contribution to the global machine learning discourse.
The research quality is evidenced by a 11.1% spotlight acceptance rate, with 4 paper(s) receiving this prestigious recognition among the conference's most impactful contributions.
India's machine learning ecosystem comprises 81 unique researchers across 33 institutions, with a balanced representation of 30 academic institutions and 3 corporate research entities.

context.title: Global Research Landscape
content: The global research landscape is led by the United States (34.1% of papers) and China (27.3%), followed by the United Kingdom (6.2%) and Germany (4.1%), with India contributing 0.6% of total research output.
India ranks 17 globally in research volume, positioning it as an emerging contributor in the international machine learning research ecosystem with substantial growth potential.

Within the Asia-Pacific region, India trails China, South Korea, Singapore, and Hong Kong in absolute research contributions, highlighting opportunities for enhanced regional collaboration and capacity building.
context.subtitle: India's position within the international machine learning research community and comparative analysis with leading nations.

focusCountry.title: India Research Ecosystem Analysis
content: India researchers exhibit strong research independence with 38.9% of papers having majority India authorship, indicating substantial domestic research capacity and reduced dependence on international collaboration.
The 63.9% first authorship rate demonstrates India researchers' leadership in conceptualizing and driving research projects, reflecting growing confidence and expertise in the field.
With 81 unique authors contributing across 36 papers, India maintains an efficient author-to-paper ratio of 0.44, suggesting productive individual contributions and effective research mentorship.
focusCountry.subtitle: Detailed examination of authorship patterns, collaboration dynamics, and research leadership within India's machine learning community.

institutions.title: Institutional Research Excellence
content: The Unknown emerges as the national leader with 0 papers and 0 authors, including the country's 4 spotlight papers, demonstrating exceptional research quality and productivity.

Academic institutions dominate India's research landscape with 90.9% representation (30 of 33 institutions), while corporate research centers contribute 9.1%, indicating strong university-led research culture.

The institutional diversity spans premier engineering institutes (IITs), specialized research universities (IISc), and corporate R&D centers, creating a robust ecosystem for sustained machine learning research growth.
institutions.subtitle: Comprehensive evaluation of India's academic and corporate institutions contributing to machine learning research excellence.
